intro: Cyanea bishopii, commonly known as Bishop's cyanea, is a rare Hawaiian shrub belonging to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is endemic to the island of Maui and is found primarily in moist, shaded habitats. Cyanea bishopii is listed as endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are underway to protect and propagate this unique botanical species.
